wiki_main_blurb: Evolve Incremental is a web based game about first evolving a species from primordial ooze into a sentient species, then guiding that new species into a mighty civilization that will eventually take to the stars and colonize space.
wiki_main_contribution: Special thanks to %0 for their contributions to the game.
wiki_faq_q_update: How do I update to the new version once an update is released?
wiki_faq_a_update: A notification will show in the top bar if an update is available. Simply refresh the page to update. You can press CTRL + F5 to reload the cache to ensure you have the new content. The game maintains backwards compatibility with older save files.
wiki_faq_q_hotkeys: What are the hotkeys for multipliers?
wiki_faq_a_hotkeys: You can hold these hotkeys to increase the amount of clicks on certain buttons: Ctrl = 10x, Shift = 25x, Alt = 100x. You can combine hotkeys; Ctrl + Alt = 1000x.
wiki_faq_a_sethotkeys: Yes, these can be set to a custom key in the settings tab.
wiki_faq_q_offline: Can I play this game offline?
wiki_faq_a_offline: No, but after you load the page it will work without Internet until the page is refreshed.
wiki_faq_q_moonphase: How long are moon phases, cycles and days?
wiki_faq_a_moonphase: A moon phase is a cycle. Cycles are 28 in-game days or 140 real seconds. Days are 5 real seconds.
wiki_faq_a_orbital: If you hover over the name of the planet on the top-left it states the orbital period of your current planet. The default period is 365 days. The orbital period changes the length of seasons, and thus weather and temperature at certain times.
wiki_faq_a_lumber: If you are an Ent, Lumber is disabled and all other building costs that would require Lumber are increased by 5% to compensate.
wiki_faq_q_farm: Why is the agriculture technology and the farm missing?
wiki_faq_a_farm: If you have the carnivore trait agriculture is disabled. Carnivores gain food from hunters. Cath are always carnivores.
wiki_faq_a_steel: After building a Barracks, Steel can be stolen from rivals with the “launch campaign” mechanic on the Civics tab. Alternatively, there is a small chance to discover it from active trade routes. After discovering it, you can trade for it. You can produce it at the Smelter after researching the Crucible Steel technology.
wiki_faq_a_aluminium: Build a Metal Refinery and have active Quarry Workers.
wiki_faq_a_titanium: You must trade for it until you have enough to afford the Hunter Process technology to produce it yourself.
wiki_faq_q_titanium_balorg: How do I get Titanium if I am playing Balorg?
wiki_faq_a_titanium_balorg: Because Balorg can't trade they can loot titanium from combat, but not from ambushes.
wiki_faq_a_polymer: Building a Factory reveals these materials in the trade menu, and they can be produced at the Factory through the Industry tab. Polymer requires the Polymer technology.
wiki_faq_a_mythril: Crafting, with Iridium and Alloy after building the Iridium Mine on the Moon.
wiki_faq_a_infernite: Build Surveyor Carports in the Hell Dimension and assign Surveyor jobs to your citizens. Surveyors must be protected by patrols.
wiki_faq_a_stanene: Stanene is produced by Factories, after researching Stanene.
wiki_faq_q_crates: How do I use crates and containers?
wiki_faq_a_crates: Freight Yards give Crates and Container Ports give Containers. Crates can quickly be moved by clicking the + symbol next to a resource. This will open up a menu that will let you construct, assign, or unassign crates/containers to that resource. They cost resources to build but can be freely moved around. Multiplier keys can be used to build or move more than one at a time. Alternatively, use the better GUI under Resources -> Storage.
wiki_faq_a_soft_reset: Soft-reset is used to reset your game back to the evolution stage without reaching a prestige point. However, you will receive no benefit from soft-resetting.
wiki_faq_a_hard_reset: A hard reset permanently deletes all your save data. You should backup your save string before doing this.
wiki_faq_q_combat: How does the combat system function?
wiki_faq_a_combat: The more soldiers you send into combat, the more that can die. Thus, the goal is to send as few as possible while still winning most of the time. Generally, attack with as few soldiers as possible while maintaining a 50% advantage.
wiki_faq_q_morale: What is the effect of morale?
wiki_faq_a_morale: Every 1% above 100% morale increases global production by 0.5%. Every 1% below 100% decreases global production by 1%.
wiki_faq_a_stress: Job stress, unemployment, weather, temperature, taxes, warmonger and entertainment. Job stress is increased with population size and cannot be lowered without the Content gene. Different races receive varying buffs or debuffs from certain weather or temperatures. Every 1% above 20% tax decreases morale by 1% up to 40%, and then every 1% above 40% tax decreases morale by 1.5%. Taxes rates below 20% increase morale by 1%. Every 2% below 21% taxes increases max morale by 1%. Warmonger is a temporary morale penalty when sending soldiers on a campaign. Entertainer jobs from the Amphitheatre and various buildings later in the game provide positive morale.
wiki_faq_a_genetic_decay: Genetic decay reduces the number of active Plasmids. However it takes a very very long time to reach decay so you shouldn't worry about it.
wiki_faq_a_cache: It gives a quantity of iron, copper, steel and cement equal to a random number between 1% and 25% of your total storage capacity for each material.
wiki_faq_q_aphrodisiac: What is the effect of the Aphrodisiac technology?
wiki_faq_a_aphrodisiac: It decreases the time needed for a new citizen to grow.
wiki_faq_a_religion: Religion is part of the prestige system. You cannot see it unless you have prestiged at least once.
wiki_faq_a_tax_riots: Tax revolts have a chance to trigger if taxes are greater then 25% and morale is less then 100%.
wiki_faq_q_race: What governs which race I get in each genus tree during the evolution stage?
wiki_faq_a_race: You can choose to evolve as any race which has completed the MAD reset. MAD resetting as 25 unique races unlocks ability to choose any race on MAD reset. The second and third resets allow you to choose any race for the next run. Without the above, the outcome is randomly seeded. Each game assigns a random seed that governs the outcome. Because it is seeded, you will always get the same race if you export your save and then import it before you made the choice, since the seed is the same.
wiki_faq_q_weather: What is the effect of weather?
wiki_faq_a_weather: Weather effects vary per species. Consult the Species page for weather effects, and consult the Planets page for specific weather rules per planet/season.
wiki_faq_a_sundial: The Sundial is the base knowledge income. +1 base, +1 after first MAD reset on the current planet, +1 after Euthanasia Perk, +1 on Magnetic planets.
wiki_faq_q_stoned: What is the "-10% stoned" production penalty?
wiki_faq_a_stoned: The Mellow Planetary Modifier gives this penalty, but also reduces stress.
wiki_faq_a_plasmid: Plasmids are the first prestige resource, all prestige options award Plasmids. They boost production and can be used to buy permanent upgrades from the CRISPR tab.
wiki_faq_q_plasmid_keep: How many Plasmids should I keep?
wiki_faq_a_plasmid_keep: The soft cap for Plasmids is 250 + Phage count. If you are using the "No Plasmids" challenge gene however you may want to just spend them all.
wiki_faq_q_plasmid_earn: What determines the amount of Plasmids I earn?
wiki_faq_a_plasmid_earn: A combination of your living population and the amount of Knowledge you have spent. Soldiers count as population for this purpose.
wiki_faq_a_crispr: They are permanent buffs that apply to all subsequent playthroughs. Sequencing the genome of your race reveals a new CRISPR tab.
wiki_faq_a_creep: It reduces the scaling cost of buildings.
wiki_faq_a_phage: Phage is the second prestige resource. It is awarded from all reset points other then Mutual Destruction.
wiki_faq_q_phage_earn: What determines the amount of Phage I earn?
wiki_faq_a_phage_earn: Phage earned is tied to the number of Plasmids earned.
wiki_faq_q_phage_benefit: What is the benefit of Phage?
wiki_faq_a_phage_benefit: Phage increases the diminishing return cap on Plasmids by the amount of Phage. There is no cap on Phage.
wiki_faq_a_anti_plasmids: If you are in the Antimatter universe, any mechanic that would normally give Plasmids will give Anti-Plasmids instead.
wiki_faq_q_temple: What is the difference between Anthropology and Fanaticism?
wiki_faq_a_temple: They open different tech trees, Anthropology tends to be better for shorter games while Fanaticism is better for longer games. Anthropology gives a flat bonus to Temples and unique technologies to buff Knowledge and money. Fanaticism gives a scaling bonus to Temples and unique bonuses to trade and combat, it also gives you the main trait of your ancestor species.
wiki_faq_q_temple_break: When does the scaling Fanaticism Temple bonus break even with Anthropology?
wiki_faq_a_temple_break: You need 15 Professors make Fanaticism break even with Anthropology.
wiki_faq_q_demonic: How do I play as the Demonic races?
wiki_faq_a_demonic: You must earn the Doomed achievement to unlock Hellscape planets.
wiki_faq_q_celestial: How do I play as the Celestial races?
wiki_faq_a_celestial: Celestial races replace demonic races inside the Evil Universe. These also require having earned Doomed to unlock.
wiki_faq_a_mastery: Mastery is a production bonus earned from completing achievements. It requires unlocking first through CRISPR.
wiki_faq_a_challenges: Buy the Hardened Gene CRISPR upgrade. Playing with Challenges give more Prestige resources when resetting. It also unlocks higher tier achievements which award more Mastery.
wiki_faq_a_perks: Perks are permanent bonuses earned from completing specific achievements.
wiki_faq_a_feats: Feats are difficult achievements intended only for completionists. Unlike Perks and normal achievements, they offer no reward.
wiki_faq_a_support: Support is a special type of power found on various space buildings. It is used to power buildings in the same category.
wiki_faq_q_micro: Can achievements be earned in the Micro universe?
wiki_faq_a_micro: Only Micro achievements can be earned for Mastery in the Micro universe. Other achievements will unlock only the Micro icon and offer no general Mastery.
wiki_faq_q_valdi: What happens if I use Fanaticism after doing the Genetic Dead End (Valdi) challenge?
wiki_faq_a_valdi: You get a random minor positive trait instead of all the negative traits.
wiki_faq_q_quantum: What does the Quantum level effect?
wiki_faq_a_quantum: Swarm Satellite cost reduction from Swarm Plants, Factory production bonus from Quantum Manufacturing technology, Warehouse storage bonus from Cargo Yards, and the Interstellar Citadel.
wiki_faq_q_quantum_level: How is the Quantum level calculated?
wiki_faq_q_exotic: Which resources count as Exotic Mass for the Mass Ejector?
wiki_faq_q_soul_gem: How do I get Soul Gems?
wiki_faq_a_soul_gem: Hell patrols have a small chance to find a Soul Gem on each encounter. Run more patrols to increase your odds of finding Soul Gems.
wiki_faq_q_soul_gem_spend: How should I spend my first Soul Gem?
wiki_faq_a_soul_gem_spend: Buy the Virtual Reality tech. Dozens of techs are gated behind it that do not require Soul Gems.
wiki_faq_q_hell_patrol: My patrols in the Hell Dimension die too quickly to replace, what do I do?
wiki_faq_a_hell_patrol: When you first enter Hell, devote all your soldiers to large patrol sizes. It will reduce the Demonic threat level without taking many losses. Then, gradually reduce the size into more patrols. Ideally balance it so that you can have as many patrols as you can reinforce, since more patrols are better if you can support the reinforcement rate.
wiki_faq_q_surveyors: How do I keep my Surveyors from dying?
wiki_faq_a_surveyors: Reduce the demonic threat level by increasing your patrols. If the threat is higher then 1500 Surveyors will die too often to be effective.
wiki_faq_q_defense: How much defense rating should the fortress have?
wiki_faq_a_defense: The demon attack strength scales to their threat rating. Hold them at less then 1500 and have a defense rating of at least 600. ~800 is very safe.
wiki_faq_q_infusion: What is the difference between Exotic Infusion and Stabilize Black Hole?
wiki_faq_a_infusion: After reaching 0.025 Solar Masses of Exotic Mass in the hole, it unlocks a research option to stabilize or infuse it. Exotic Infusion triggers the Black Hole reset, Stabilize Black Hole destroys all Exotic Mass in the black hole converting it into regular mass at a 1:40 ratio. Stabilize is used to pump up the energy generated.
wiki_faq_q_dark_energy: What determines the amount of Dark Energy I receive?
wiki_faq_a_dark_energy: The amount of Mass and Exotic Mass in the hole, according to this formula: (LN(1 + (exotic mass * 40))) + (log2(mass - 7)/2.5)).
wiki_basics_start_para1: Evolve is a civilization building game, the goal is to develop your species into the best it can be.
wiki_basics_start_para2: This guide will give an overview of the gameplay basics, if you wish to discover things for yourself then you should stop reading.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para1: Before you can start conquering the world you must first evolve into a sentient species.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para2: This first phase of the game allows you to guide evolution towards a genus of your choosing.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para3: There are two resources in this phase of the game: %0 and %1.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para4: %0 will passively generate %1, and %2 will generate %3.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para5: Increase your resource capacities by construction %0, %1, or %2.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para6: Many of the techs will warn you that you are at an evolutionary fork, this is a decision you are making that will effect the outcome of evolution.

wiki_basics_prehistoric_para10: Some of these traits can drastically alter gameplay.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para11: You should not over think your choice here, you will have the opportunity to play other races down the line.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para12: New players often ask what race is best, there is no one best race. They are all different but no race is strictly better or worse then other races.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para13: When you reach %0 that will end this phase of the game giving you a random race from the genus type you have chosen.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para14: There is no point to over building during this phase of the game as it will not carry over into the next phase.
wiki_basics_civilization_para1: After you have evolved into a sentient species you can begin to build your civilization.
wiki_basics_civilization_para2: The first thing you will need to do is construct some housing and get some citizens.
wiki_basics_civilization_para3: Citizens are the workforce of your city, you can manage what jobs they are assigned to on the %0 tab.
wiki_basics_civilization_para4: You will want to assign your first citizen to gather %0, depending on your species that will either be the %1 or %2 job.
wiki_basics_civilization_para5: The job with an %0 after it is the default job, new citizens will automatically be assigned to the default job.
wiki_basics_civilization_para6: You can change the default job by clicking on another job in the civics tab.
wiki_basics_civilization_para7: You can only assign default job status to the basic job types (those with no cap on them).
wiki_basics_civilization_para8: The earliest challenge is getting enough %0 income to keep your people fed.
wiki_basics_civilization_para9: If you run out of %0 you will go into a %1 state which lowers production.
wiki_basics_civilization_para10: If the amount of %0 you are producing is significantly below your required consumption then people will starve to death.
wiki_basics_civilization_para11: Increase your %0 storage limit to help cover periods of reduced production such as cold weather.
wiki_basics_civilization_para12: You will also want to focus early on any technologies that help with %0 production so you can shift population to other tasks.
wiki_basics_civilization_para13: The primary barrier to progress is %0. Increasing your maximum %0 so you can research more advanced technologies is the main method of advancement.
wiki_basics_civilization_para14: Your first %0 increasing building is the %1. Construct these to allow discovery of more advanced technologies.
wiki_basics_government_para1: Once you unlock %0 you will want to set one in the %1 tab to remove %2.
wiki_basics_government_para2: If you fail to set a %0 you will be in %1 which will cause a growing production penalty depending on how many citizens you have.
wiki_basics_government_para3: There is a cooldown period after changing your %0 type, after which you can change it again.
wiki_basics_government_para4: You will also want to pay attention to your %0.
wiki_basics_government_para5: High %0 (above 100%) will give you a global production bonus while lower %0 (below 100%) will cause a production malus.
wiki_basics_government_para6: The primary method of raising your %0 is through the %1 job, and the primary method of losing %0 is from %2.
wiki_basics_government_para7: Changing your %0 will also affect %1. Higher %0 causes lower %1 and vice versa.
wiki_basics_government_para8: If you raise your taxes above %0% and have morale lower then %1% it can cause a tax riot. These are bad, you should aim to avoid riots.
wiki_basics_mad_para1: The goal of your first playthrough should be to reach %0.
wiki_basics_mad_para2: This is a %0 option that appears on the %1 -> %2 tab once unlocked.
wiki_basics_mad_para3: If you go into %0 then you have overshot the first reset point.
wiki_basics_mad_para4: You can continue to play deeper into the game but it is recommended you reset as soon as possible as the prestige gain is significant.

wiki_tech_vaccine_campaign2: The race gets vaccinated at a rate of (1/150)% per %0 per game day until Vaccination is at 25%. Then (1/450)% until reaching 50% Vaccination. Then (1/1200)% until 75%, stopping after that point unless a Vaccination Strategy is chosen.

wiki_tech_iso_gambling: Bankers boost Money income from Casinos by +5%.
wiki_tech_outpost_boost: Doubles Plasmid and Anti-Plasmid production bonuses.

wiki_structure_planetary_slaughter: Basic gathering option for Evil races, this replaces the other standard gathering methods.
wiki_structure_space_terraformer: Only available in Orbital Decay challenge.
wiki_structure_stardock_geck: Must be unlocked first by completing an advanced challenge called Orbital Decay.
wiki_structure_stardock_geck2: These can also be used during a Blackhole reset.
wiki_mechanics_save_para1: The game is automatically saved once per game day (%0 seconds).
wiki_mechanics_save_para2: Local Storage is used to save your game data, if you wipe out your browsers local storage you will lose your game progress.
wiki_mechanics_save_para3: You can also manually %0 your game state at any time from the settings tab.
wiki_mechanics_save_para4: It is highly recommended you make %0 saves to backup your game at regular intervals.
wiki_mechanics_save_para5: The %0 feature can also be used to revert your game to just prior to your last reset.
wiki_mechanics_save_para6: This is also stored in your browsers local storage and is no more secure then the active game data.
wiki_mechanics_save_para7: Do not attempt to treat it as a safe progress backup, exporting is best for that.
wiki_mechanics_save_para8: %0 merely lets you revert your game to just prior to your last reset in case you screw up your game somehow.
wiki_mechanics_atime_para1: If you pause the game or close the game window %0 is awarded.
wiki_mechanics_atime_para2: There must be at least a %0 minute pause before resuming or no %1 is earned.
wiki_mechanics_atime_para3: The next time the game is resumed it will run at %0 game speed until all the %1 is used.
wiki_mechanics_atime_para4: %0 is gained at a rate of one minute for every one and half minutes the game is stopped, however it caps at a maximum of %1 hours.
wiki_mechanics_atime_para5: It takes %0 hours of stopped time to reach the %1 hour cap of %2.
wiki_mechanics_atime_para6: %0 does not carry over to the next run if a reset is used.
wiki_mechanics_spack_para1: String Packs are %0 encoded, %1 formatted %2 files that can be imported into the game.
wiki_mechanics_spack_para2: They can be used to change the strings used, allowing for textual customization of the game.
wiki_mechanics_spack_para3: String Packs can range from entirely retheming the game to simple micro-personalizations.
wiki_mechanics_spack_para4: The process of creating a String Pack is the similar to creating a language file for the game, which is explained %0.
wiki_mechanics_spack_para5: Different from contributing a language, however, a String Pack can be called anything you want and isn't actually added to the base game, simply locally imported into your game client.
wiki_mechanics_spack_para6: For example, a String Pack that looks like this would rename %0 to %1 and %2 to %3.
wiki_mechanics_multiplier_para1: %0 can be used to enact most actions multiple times.
wiki_mechanics_multiplier_para2: There are %0 (%1), %2 (%3), and %4 (%5) keys and they can be combined for greater effect.
wiki_mechanics_multiplier_para3: The keys can be rebound on the settings tab.
wiki_mechanics_multiplier_para4: %0 work on just about anything that can be clicked except for manual resource gathering.
wiki_mechanics_multiplier_para5: If you think clicking something is repetitive, then you are doing it wrong; use the %0.
wiki_mechanics_job_para1: The %0 is the job that new population automatically fill by default.
wiki_mechanics_job_para2: It is denoted by the job with an %0 next to it.
wiki_mechanics_job_para3: You can change the %0 by clicking on another basic job.
wiki_mechanics_job_para4: Only the basic jobs can be set as the default job.
wiki_mechanics_job_para5: The default job acts as a staging ground for your population.
wiki_mechanics_job_para6: If a citizen dies, one is reasigned automatically from the default job to cover the loss.
wiki_mechanics_job_para7: If you lose more population then can be covered by those in the default job then other jobs will start to suffer loses.
wiki_mechanics_job_para8: New citizens will then be auto assigned away from the default job to replace those lost elsewhere, thus the default job will be the last to recover.
wiki_mechanics_job_para9: If you are having problems managing your food supply then it is a very bad idea to use farmers at the default job as this ensures farmers will be the first job vacated.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para1: Job stress is a malus to morale generated by each working person in your civilization, providing a different amount of stress depending on the job they work in.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para2: Other than by making people %0 or getting rid of your population, the only way to actively reduce job stress is getting levels of the %1 minor trait.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para3: Each job type has its own %0, a value divided into %1 to calculate the amount of stress that each person assigned to that job generates.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para4: Stress divisors can be affected by a number of things, like the %0 trait, the %1 trait, %2 planets, and more.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para5: Differently from regular job types, the job stress generated by soldiers is linked to the current max number of soldiers rather than the number of soldiers alive.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para6: The %0 and %1 traits apply a flat bonus/malus to the %2 value reflected in the %3 tooltip, not individually impacting the job stress of any actual job.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para7: Some governments and %0 foreign powers apply overall multipiers to the total job stress generated by your people.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para1: Cost creep is the number that the resource cost of a building is multiplied by for each constructed amount of that building, creating an exponential cost scaling.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para2: If, for example, the %0 cost of a building starts at %1 and has a cost creep of %2, then after getting one of those buildings the next one will cost %3 %0, the one after that will cost %4 %0, and so on.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para3: Buildings that can be purchased in theoretically unlimited amounts are affected by cost creep, as are %0 projects.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para4: There are various traits, upgrades, and perks throughout the game that affect the cost creeps of many different buildings.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para5: For example, the %0 tech reduces the cost creeps of some early-game housing buildings, the %1 trait increases the cost creeps of all homeworld structures, and the %2 %3 upgrades affect the cost creeps of all buildings.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para6: While there are many things in the game that can affect the cost creep of buildings, only the %0 trait affects the cost creep of %1 projects.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para7: The cost creep of any given building cannot fall below %0.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para1: %0 are a feature that is unlocked by researching %1.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para2: Once unlocked the %0 can be used to create a list of construction projects which will automatically be constructed once the resources are available.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para3: Items in the building queue will be constructed in order.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para4: A %0 can be unlocked later with a tech called %1.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para5: This opens up a second queue on the research tab which is used solely for research.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para6: Items are added to the queue anytime you attempt to build something but can not currently afford it.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para7: You can add an item to the queue which is currently purchasable by holding the %0 (%1).
wiki_mechanics_queue_para8: The %0 requires being enabled on the settings tab and can also be remapped there.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para9: The queue can be reordered simply by dragging the queued items in the list.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para10: The queue behavior can also be changed on the settings tab using the %0 option to build anything that is affordable instead of building in order.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para11: By default the queue will merge together nearby items if they are for the same building.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para12: Through changing the %0 setting, this behavior can be changed to either never merge items or to always merge items regardless of their position in the queue.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para13: Each queue can be paused/played by toggling the pause/play buttons next to the queue counters, which when paused will stop them from building/researching anything queued until resumed.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_para1: Structures that affect the game by a percentage value generally fall into 2 categories: Production or Discounting.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_prod_para1: Production structures are those which increase a value and typically stack additively with each other.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_prod_para2: An additively stacking bonus works by a simple forumla of:
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_prod_para4: A Powered Mine for example boosts Miner production by 5%, owning 2 will give a total bonus of 10%, and 20 mines a total bonus of 100%.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_dis_para1: Discounting structures are those which decrease a value and are applied multiplicatively with each other.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_dis_para2: A multiplicatively stacking bonus generally works by the formula:
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_dis_para4: These kinds of bonuses are typically applied to make something cheaper.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_dis_para5: The %0 for example decreases fuel costs.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_dis_para6: If a fuel cost has a base value of %0 and each %1 discounts that cost by %2 then 1 %1 will lower the cost to %3 and 20 %1 will lower the cost to %4.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_dis_para7: The cost would not become free since %0 * %1 ^ %2 = %3.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_exception: Exceptions may apply to these rules but are usually stated if they work in an unusual way.
wiki_mechanics_blocking_para1: When a building has resources which you currently have insufficant quantity of it will show which resources you lack using a color coded system.
wiki_mechanics_blocking_para2: With the default game theme (Gruvbox Dark) the resource that will take the longest to get the required amount of will show up in %0.
wiki_mechanics_blocking_para3: Other resouces you currently have insufficant quantity of will be displayed in %0.
wiki_mechanics_blocking_para4: If you queue a stack of structures for construction and the blocking resource on the first in the stack is different from the last one in the stack a gradient effect will be used to show this.
wiki_mechanics_blocking_para5: In this case the blocking resource with longest time to aquire for the first in the stack will be shown with %0 on the left, and the resource which will take the longest to aquire to complete the entire stack will be shown in %0 on the right.
wiki_mechanics_bank_vault_para1: The %0, %1, and %2 all scale their %3 storage off of the same %4, as does the %5 during %6.
wiki_mechanics_bank_vault_para2: This means that anything that buffs the %0 storage of the %1 will affect all of these buildings, including things like the %2 tech, the %3 governor, the %4 trait, %5 levels, %6, %7, etc.
wiki_mechanics_homeless_para1: If you turn off housing, citizens become homeless.

wiki_government_info_para8: Don't be afraid to experiment as you can always switch again once the cooldown period is over.

wiki_government_theocracy_para7: Theocracy is not available on your first game run.

wiki_government_republic_para6: When protests occur they cause a global production penalty of %0.
wiki_government_republic_para7: Protests can last anywhere from %0 to %1 days, the exact length is random.
wiki_government_socialist_para3: Factories, Cement Workers, and Graphene Plants gain a %0 bonus.

wiki_governor_intro_para1: Governors can be appointed after unlocking the CRISPR tech %0.
wiki_governor_intro_para2: There are %0 different backgrounds to choose your governor from.
wiki_governor_intro_para4: You can fire your governor if you choose but it costs Plasmids to do so and it gets more costly every time you do it so think twice about your choice.
wiki_governor_task_para1: The main function of a governor is the ability to assign them tasks which they do on your behalf.
wiki_governor_task_para2: Governors can handle a maximum of %0 tasks, except for the %1 who can manage %2 totals tasks.

wiki_governor_task_tax1: The Tax-morale balancer adjusts your tax rate automatically to get the highest tax rate while keeping morale at maximum.
wiki_governor_task_tax2: It will lower and raise taxes as necessary depending on your morale level.
wiki_governor_task_storage1: The Crate Constructor will automatically build crates or containers.
wiki_governor_task_storage2: This does not assign them to resources but merely keeps you topped off on available crates/containers.
wiki_governor_task_bal_storage1: The Crate Manager will automatically assign crates and containers to resources.
wiki_governor_task_bal_storage2: It will attempt to distribute them evenly, except for Coal and Food which have special rules.
wiki_governor_task_bal_storage3: You can configure it to change the distribution ratios.
wiki_governor_task_merc1: The Merc Recruiter will automatically use excess funds to buy mercenaries to keep your army strong.
wiki_governor_task_merc2: You can set a buffer amount to allow for natural training of replacement soldiers.
wiki_governor_task_merc3: It will not automatically buy any mercs unless the number of missing soldiers exceeds the buffer value.
wiki_governor_task_spy1: The Spy Recruiter will automatically use excess funds to buy replacement spies.
wiki_governor_task_spyop1: The Spy Operator will automatically send spy missions against rival cities.
wiki_governor_task_spyop2: It requires at least %0 spy available to start a %1 mission.
wiki_governor_task_spyop3: It requires at least %0 spies available to start an %1 mission.
wiki_governor_task_spyop4: It will not attempt to Annex or Purchase any cities.
wiki_governor_task_spyop5: By default it will prioritize missions in the order of %0 -> %1 -> %2 if the required amount of spies is met, however the order can be dragged around to change it.
wiki_governor_task_slave1: The Slave Recruiter will automatically use excess funds to buy replace slaves.
wiki_governor_task_sacrifice1: The Sacrificer task will automatically sacrifice a citizen whenever you are at maximium capacity.
wiki_governor_task_horseshoe1: The %0 task will automatically create %1 for you when you have spare materials.
wiki_governor_task_trash1: The Mass Ejector Optimizer will automatically manage your Mass Ejector for you.
wiki_governor_task_trash2: It will shift the ejector to get the highest total mass per second ejected while using only resources which are capped.
wiki_governor_task_trash3: You can set a minimum volume for Elerium, Infernite, Copper, or Iron to ensure those are constantly being ejected regardless of production and current storage amounts.
wiki_governor_task_trash3min: In this mode designated by 'Res <=' it will eject at most the volume specified while under resource cap.
wiki_governor_task_trash3a: You can alternatively set a maximum for Elerium, Infernite, Copper, or Iron to ensure those are constantly being ejected.
wiki_governor_task_trash3max: In this mode designated by 'Res >=' it will eject any production in excess of volume specified while under resource cap.
wiki_governor_task_trash4: Requires that you own at least one %0.
wiki_governor_task_mech1: The Mech Constructor will automatically build a variety of mech types for your spire needs.
wiki_governor_task_mech2: It will attempt to field a wide variety of mech classes, weapons, chassis, and equipment to hedge bets against any floor type.
wiki_governor_task_mech3: It will not scrap mechs or attempt to optimize them for the current floor but instead try to build an assortment of mechs that are effective on average.
wiki_governor_task_mech4: Requires having completed at least %0 %1 and to have access to %2.
wiki_combat_basics_para1: Once you build a barracks and get some soldiers you can attack rival cities for resources.
wiki_combat_basics_para2: To initiate an attack go to the civics tab and manage your army, there is also a special military tab that shows all military information.
wiki_combat_basics_para3: Assign soldiers to your battalion to use them in an attack campaign.
wiki_combat_basics_para4: Pick a type of campaign to wage, and then pick a target and press attack to steal resources from that rival city.
wiki_combat_campaign_para1: There are %0 different types of war campaigns: %1, %2, %3, %4, & %5.
wiki_combat_campaign_para2: When you attack a rival there is a chance of success or failure depending on the campaign type and the military strength of your chosen target.
wiki_combat_campaign_para3: %0 is the easiest campaign type having the lowest risk but also the lowest payoff, as you progress to harder campaign types the risk increases but so do the rewards.
wiki_combat_campaign_para4: %0 is the hardest campaign type having the most risk but also the largest payoff, it also offers an opportunity to occupy an enemy city if at least %1 of your soldiers survive the battle.
wiki_combat_campaign_para5: Every soldier you commit to the battle has a chance to be wounded or killed.
wiki_combat_campaign_para6: If you send wounded soldiers into battle they have a very high chance to die.
wiki_combat_campaign_para7: Healthy soldiers will be committed to battle before wounded soldiers, but if you do not have enough healthy soldiers to fill your battalion then wounded soldiers will be sent into battle.
wiki_combat_campaign_para8: You should allow your soldiers time to heal rather then sending wounded soldiers into battle as this will almost always result in high casualties.
wiki_combat_campaign_para9: Over committing soldiers to an offensive action is also a mistake, this increases the number of soldiers that can be wounded or die in a single attack action.
wiki_combat_campaign_para10: You should never send max soldiers into combat unless you need them to win, always use the smallest battalion size that gets you a good win rate.
wiki_combat_campaign_para11: A %0 advantage is a %1 chance to win.
wiki_combat_campaign_para12: The advantage/disadvantage rating is how far above or below the %0/%0 win/loss rate you are.
wiki_combat_campaign_para13: Typically you want to aim for around %0 advantage, no advantage no matter how big will guarantee you a %1 win rate but a nice advantage will cause you to win the overwhelming amount of the time.
wiki_combat_campaign_para14: If your combat advantage is above %0 then you should consider lowering your battalion size to reduce casualties.

wiki_challenges_intro_para1: Challenges are optional modifiers to the game that can be enabled each run during the evolution stage that make the game more difficult.

wiki_challenges_scenarios_truepath_rival: A new Rival foreign power emerges after gaining Rocketry or Unite.
Relations with the rival impacts Trade Route gains.
Good Relations with the rival can result in an alliance where they help with some production.
Bad Relations with the rival can result in an enemy where they hurt some production.
Relations with rival can also cause them to help guard some sectors against Syndicate aggression.
wiki_challenges_scenarios_truepath_syndi: A criminal Syndicate emerges during the deep space era.
Syndicate activity affects most of known space and works similar to the Piracy mechanic.
wiki_challenges_scenarios_lone_survivor_: The %0 %1 starts with the game in the %2 system.
In this special game mode your population is capped at 1.
The altered rules of the %0 scenario apply in this mode.
This %0 is completed upon performing the %1 reset.
wiki_resets_intro_para1: The main method of gaining prestige is through executing a reset option. There are currently %0 reset methods: %1.
wiki_resets_intro_para2: Each option restarts the game and awards prestige resources which accelerates your progress.
wiki_resets_intro_para3: After resetting your first time you will also unlock religion, your new race will always consider whatever race came before them to be their gods.
wiki_resets_mad_para1: Mutual Assured Destruction is the first reset option encountered.
wiki_resets_mad_para2: It it generally recommended that you use this option on your first playthrough as soon as you are able to.
wiki_resets_mad_para3: This unlocks just before the space era and will award %0.
wiki_resets_mad_para4: To unlock this research %0 and then %1. There is no need to build the Launch Facility.
wiki_resets_mad_para5: The option to reset will appear on the %0 -> %1 tab.
wiki_resets_mad_para6: The number of %0 earned will be based on a combination of your total population and knowledge spent.
wiki_resets_mad_para7: Build anything you can within reason that will boost your population before resetting to maximize your %0 gained.
wiki_resets_mad_para8: Soldiers count as population for this purpose.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para1: Bioseed is the second reset option normally encountered in game progression.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para2: To Bioseed reset you must construct and launch the %0.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para3: A Bioseed reset will award both %0 and %1. The amount of %1 earned is derived from the amount of %0 earned so raising your %0 reward will also raise your %1 reward.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para4: %0 earned are calculated similarly to in MAD except there is a higher emphasis placed on knowledge spent.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para5: To construct the %0 you must first construct the %1. Once complete open the %1 menu by pressing the gear icon and start building your %0.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para6: You can also construct %0 in the %1.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para7: Once your %0 is complete you will be able to launch it which triggers the reset mechanic.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para8: Bioseed will also let you change your planet.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para9: The number of planet options depends on the number of %0 you construct. You get one planet plus one more for each %1 built.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para10: Planets can have a variety of new traits, see the %0 section for more information.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para11: Your new planet is permanent until changed again using a reset mechanic.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para1: Black Hole is the third reset option normally encountered in game progression. It is found at the end of the Interstellar phase of the game.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para2: A Black Hole reset will award %0, %1, and %2. %0 & %1 follow an improved version of the MAD/Bioseed formula while %2 is awarded based on the mass of the black hole.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para3: To Black Hole reset first you must construct the %0; then you have to beef it up until it it ready to explode.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para4: Increase the mass by building a %0 and using it to eject %1 into the black hole until it reaches %2 solar masses of %1. Only %3 and %4 count as %1.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para5: Increasing regular mass is not required to trigger the Black Hole reset but it will boost the amount of %0 earned.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para6: Once you have enough %0 in the black hole you can reset using a special research option called %1.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para8: If you instead research %0 you will flush all the %1 out of the black hole and have to build it back up again.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para9: Exploding the black hole results in the destruction of your current universe and lets you pick a new one.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para10: This is the method for switching universes allowing you to reset into one of the following %0 new universes: %1.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para11: In addition to changing universes you will be able to pick from a limited selection of four planets.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para13: Advanced players will be allowed to use their G.E.C.K. if they have any.
wiki_resets_ascension_para1: Ascension is the fourth reset option normally encountered in game progression. It is found at the end of the Intergalactic phase of the game.
wiki_resets_ascension_para2: An Ascension reset will award %0, %1, and %2. %0 & %1 following an improved version of the MAD/Bioseed formula while %2 are awarded based on the number of challenge genes activated.
wiki_resets_ascension_para3: Ascending requires building the %0 (Constructed at Sirius on the Interstellar tab) and powering it with %1MW. This power requirement can be reduced by building %2.
wiki_resets_ascension_para4: Note that before starting your journey into Intergalactic that building the ascension machine requires you spend %0 Plasmids and %1 Phage.
wiki_resets_ascension_para5: Completing ascension will also allow you to build a custom race. You get one custom race slot, doing a second ascension will allow you to alter or replace your previous custom race.
wiki_resets_ascension_para6: Earning ascension in multiple universes and with more challenges active will grant you more design points to build a better custom race with.
wiki_resets_ascension_para7: Ascending on a planet increases all existing geologies by %0 and turns it into an Ascended planet.
wiki_resets_ascension_para8: Ascended planets have %0 base Knowledge/s to the Sundial, %1 global production, and %2 global storage that stay until you leave the planet.
wiki_resets_ascension_para9: While repeated ascensions on a planet will continue to increase the values of the geology deposits, they will not make a planet more Ascended, meaning that those bonuses will not stack from multiple ascensions.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para1: Cataclysm is a special reset option that can only be encountered while playing on an %0 planet.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para2: To trigger the Cataclysm you must construct and power the %0 then wait for a random earthquake event to occur.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para3: After the earthquake event you can start the Cataclysm by using the special research %0, picking %1 instead will permanently lock out the Cataclysm for that run.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para4: Once triggered it will place you into a special scenario where you have no home planet. You will continue playing the same race and will not go through evolution again.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para5: Your starting state is predetermined, so do not attempt to game the system by building up excess buildings and materials first as these will not carry over.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para6: You will gain %0 and %1 on par with a Bioseed reset.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para7: Cataclysm is a brutally slow game mode, you should not try it unless you have a lot of prestige.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para8: You can soft reset to get out of Cataclysm if you decide you aren't ready for it.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para9: Once unlocked the Cataclysm scenario can be picked as a starting game state from the evolution challenge menu.
wiki_resets_terraform_para1: %0 is a special reset option that can only be encountered while playing the %1 challenge.
wiki_resets_terraform_para2: This takes the place of %0 and is considered the same tier reset.
wiki_resets_terraform_para3: A Terraforming reset will award %0, %1, and %2.
wiki_resets_terraform_para4: You will also be awarded the opportunity to design a custom planet.
wiki_resets_terraform_para5: Your planet is not persistent and will be lost if you complete any reset that changes planets.
wiki_resets_terraform_para6: Reaching Terraforming can be brutally hard, you should not try it unless you have a lot of prestige.
wiki_resets_terraform_para7: Achieving silver star %0 will let the last planet you designed in each universe be found randomly in the future.
wiki_resets_terraform_para8: You can add %0 unique planet to the pool per universe.
wiki_resets_terraform_para9: Truepath Orbit Decay gives you more planetary points to spend but is very hard, you should not try it.
wiki_resets_terraform_para10: Your planet will have a one time bonus called %0.
wiki_resets_terraform_para11: The rejuvenated effect is only valid for the next run while the planet is still fresh.
wiki_resets_terraform_para12: The rejuvenated effect has the following properties:
wiki_resets_terraform_para13: Boosts some labor jobs by %0 (Cement Workers, Miners, Lumberjacks).
wiki_resets_terraform_para15: Boosts soldier healing (strength depends on highest level of Orbit Decay challenge completed).
wiki_resets_terraform_para16: Boosts global production by %0-%1 (decays over time).
wiki_resets_terraform_para18: Increases extremity of various planetary effects.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para1: Causing the destruction of the universe by collapsing the false vacuum is a special reset method that only exists in the Magic universe.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para2: This reset serves the same general purpose as black hole allowing you to change universes.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para3: It replaces the Black Hole reset used in other universes, black holes are not available in a Magic Universe.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para4: In order to trigger a Vacuum Collapse you must construct %0 Mana Syphons.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para5: Mana Syphons are an A.R.P.A. project and appear on the A.R.P.A. Projects tab.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para6: Each completed Syphon causes damage to the universe and adds a stacking irreversible debuff called %0.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para7: When the %0th Syphon is completed the reset will trigger automatically.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para8: Vacuum Collapse will award %0, %1, and %2 similar to a Black Hole reset.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para9: The %0 earned however is not based on the black hole size, it is instead based on your total amount of mana generation.
wiki_resets_infusion_para1: Sacrifice your entire civilization to absorb the essence of a greater demon lord and take your place as a ruler of the hell dimension.
wiki_resets_infusion_para2: This is a special late game reset used to obtain %0.
wiki_resets_infusion_para3: It does not offer any of the other basic prestige currencies.
wiki_resets_infusion_para4: To reach this reset you must conquer the Hell Spire.
wiki_resets_infusion_para5: Once you construct the Waygate you can use it to reach a demon lord. Defeating the demon lord will award a %0.
wiki_resets_infusion_para6: Consume the %0 on the research tab to trigger the reset.
wiki_resets_infusion_para7: Your next race will gain a buff called %0, this buff will decay by 2% in value after every reset until it fully dissipates.
wiki_resets_ai_para1: Get your civilization wiped out by your own self aware creation.
wiki_resets_ai_para2: This reset is available only in %0 Scenario game mode.
wiki_resets_ai_para3: To trigger this reset you must construct the %0 and raise %1 to %2.
wiki_resets_ai_para4: Then you can execute %0 which triggers the reset.
wiki_resets_ai_para5: You increase AI Drift by constructing more: %0, %1, %2, or %3.
wiki_resets_ai_para7: Completing this reset will unlock the %0 genus.
wiki_resets_matrix_para1: Build a computer simulation and trap your entire civilization in it.
wiki_resets_matrix_para2: This reset is available only in %0 Scenario game mode.
wiki_resets_matrix_para3: To trigger this reset you must construct the %0.
wiki_resets_matrix_para4: Then you can take the blue pill which triggers the reset.
wiki_resets_retired_para1: Retire and enjoy the easy life.
wiki_resets_retired_para2: This reset is available only in %0 Scenario game mode.
wiki_resets_retired_para3: To trigger this reset you must construct the %0 and %1.
wiki_resets_retired_para4: Then you can retire which triggers the reset.
wiki_resets_eden_para1: Create a new Garden of Eden.
wiki_resets_eden_para2: This reset is available only in %0 Scenario game mode.
wiki_resets_eden_para3: To trigger this reset you must construct the %0.
wiki_resets_eden_para4: Then you can build the %0 which triggers the reset.
wiki_calc_plasmid_gains_total: Total %0 Gains If Over Soft Cap
wiki_p_res_plasmids_para1: Plasmids provide a global production bonus. They have a softcap of %0 which can be raised with Phage.
wiki_p_res_plasmids_para2: With CRISPR upgrades Plasmids can also gain a storage boosting effect. This extra benefit is not limited by the Plasmid softcap.
wiki_p_res_antiplasmids_para1: Anti-Plasmids are a special variant of Plasmids which are earned only in the Anti-Matter universe.
wiki_p_res_antiplasmids_para2: In the Anti-Matter universe Anti-Plasmids replace regular Plasmids and are awarded instead of Plasmids from anything that would normally give Plasmids.
wiki_p_res_antiplasmids_para3: Normal Plasmids do not work in the Anti-Matter universe, and Anti-Plasmids do not work outside the Anti-Matter universe.
wiki_p_res_antiplasmids_para4: The %0 CRISPR upgrade can change the relationship between Plasmids/Anti-Plasmids and universes allowing their effects partly operate outside their native universe.
wiki_p_res_antiplasmids_para5: Anti-Plasmids are not disabled by the No Starting Plasmids challenge.
wiki_p_res_phage_para1: Phage extends the Plasmid soft cap by 1 per Phage.
wiki_p_res_phage_para2: With CRISPR upgrades they can also provide a storage bonus.
wiki_p_res_phage_para3: Phage can also be used to purchase permanent ranks of minor traits in the genetics tab.
wiki_p_res_phage_para4: Phage purchased ranks of minor traits are retained on reset and count twice after a reset.
wiki_p_res_dark_para1: Dark Energy is earned from the Black Hole or Vacuum Collapse resets; its effect is different in each universe type:
wiki_p_res_dark_standard: Standard universe, Dark Energy boosts storage capacity.
wiki_p_res_dark_evil: Evil universe, Dark Energy increases combat loot and gives a slight Soul Gem drop rate increase.
wiki_p_res_dark_heavy: Heavy universe, Dark Energy reduces space fuel costs.
wiki_p_res_dark_antimatter: Antimatter universe, Dark Energy increases Power generated by all power sources.
wiki_p_res_dark_micro: Micro universe, Dark Energy reduces cost creep.
wiki_p_res_dark_magic: Magic universe, Dark Energy increases mana generation.
wiki_p_res_harmony_para1: Harmony Crystals are earned from the Ascension and Terraforming resets.
wiki_p_res_harmony_para2: The crystals boost the effects of Dark Energy and provide a non-homeworld cost creep discount.
wiki_p_res_harmony_para3: The cost creep discount only works if you have Ascended in the current universe, its strength depends on the challenge level the ascension was completed on.
wiki_p_res_blood_para1: Blood Stones are a resource earned by beating spire levels deep in the hell dimension.
wiki_p_res_blood_para2: The stones can be used in the %0 tab to buy special upgrades.
wiki_p_res_blood_para3: Each spire floor beaten awards a base of %0 Blood Stone plus %0 per challenge gene active (%1).
wiki_p_res_blood_para4: The %0 CRIPSR perk doubles Blood Stone gains.
wiki_p_res_blood_para5: Blood Stones are lost on reset unless you have the %0 CRISPR perk.
wiki_p_res_artifact_para1: Artifacts are gained by completing the %0 reset.
wiki_p_res_artifact_para2: They are required to purchase various %0 upgrades.
wiki_p_res_artifact_para3: Most, but not all, upgrades require %0 Artifact on every %1 level.
wiki_p_res_ai_core_para1: AI Cores are gained by completing the %0 reset.
wiki_p_res_ai_core_para2: They passively boost your Quantum Level.
wiki_p_res_servants_para1: Servants are gained by completing a %0, %1, or %2 reset.
wiki_p_res_servants_para2: They can work any basic job and join shortly after starting a new game.
wiki_p_res_servants_para3: Servants have no upkeep and do not affect morale.
wiki_p_res_servants_para4: If no basic jobs are available they will be able to work as Scavengers.
wiki_p_res_servants_para5: You can also gain some Servants from the %0 perk.
wiki_p_res_skilled_servants_para1: Skilled Servants are gained by completing a %0 and %1 reset.
wiki_p_res_skilled_servants_para2: Skilled Servants work non-special craftsman jobs to create crafted resources and join shortly after starting a new game.
wiki_p_res_skilled_servants_para3: Skilled Servants have no upkeep and do not affect morale.
wiki_p_res_skilled_servants_para4: You must complete both resets in even parity to gain Skilled Servants.
wiki_p_res_skilled_servants_para5: Whichever reset you have completed less times will be the number of Skilled Servants earned.
wiki_p_res_skilled_servants_para6: You can also gain some Skilled Servants from the %0 or %1 perks.
wiki_reset_intro: The main method of gaining prestige is to reset your run, there are currently %0 methods available for doing this
wiki_arpa_crispr: The CRISPR Lab is unlocked under the ARPA tab and can be used to spend Plasmids to buy permanent upgrades.
wiki_arpa_blood: The Blood Infusion tab is unlocked under the ARPA tab and can be used to spend Blood Stones to buy permanent upgrades.
wiki_arpa_projects: The A.R.P.A. Projects tab is where you can build special super projects. These projects are expensive and can be built in increments. They have no limits and can be repeated infinitely.
wiki_arpa_project_launch_facility: The launch facility is a special one time project with only one rank, it unlocks the space tab and then vanishes from the projects page.
wiki_arpa_project_monument: There are %0 different types of monuments: %1. Each monument type costs a different resource type but they all have the same end effect.
wiki_arpa_project_monument_random: The monument type chosen is picked randomly. The same monument will not be picked twice in a row.
wiki_arpa_project_monument_exceptions: The Pillar of Bones is only available to Evil races, and the Megalith is only available in the Magic universe.
wiki_arpa_project_railway_homeless: Railways have a hidden effect of reducing homeless population faster. Breakpoints occur at: %0, %1, %2, %3, %4, %5, %6, %7, & %8 Railways. Everytime a breakpoint is reached the odds of reducing homeless each day increases.
wiki_arpa_project_roid_eject: Black hole mass gained from asteroids does not contribute to required masses for any achievement goals nor Dark Energy gained on Black Hole reset.
wiki_hell_threat_para1: Unchecked threat will keep growing until it reaches %0.
wiki_hell_threat_para2: The main goal in hell is to reduce this threat level to around %0 and keep it there.
wiki_hell_threat_para3: The primary way of doing this is with patrols, larger patrols will suffer less casualties but more numerous smaller patrols will more effectively combat the threat.
wiki_hell_siege_para1: Periodically the demons will launch an assault on your fortress, this is where fortress defense comes into play.
wiki_hell_siege_para2: The strength of the assault is directly proportional to the overall threat level, so keeping the threat low will weaken the siege.
wiki_hell_siege_para3: Unchecked threat is undefendable, if you take a siege with %0 threat it's almost guaranteed you'll suffer a fortress overrun.
wiki_hell_siege_para4: Defenses repel the demon assault, the higher your defense rating is the less wall damage you will take.
wiki_hell_siege_para5: With enough defense and proper threat reduction management your fortress will be totally secure.
wiki_hell_strategy_para1: It's generally a good idea to start with a small number of large patrols and then transition to a larger number of smaller patrols as you get the threat down.
wiki_hell_strategy_para2: Make sure you can replace your soldiers quick enough that you don't lose patrols due to running out of soldiers, this can lead to a death spiral if you are not able to replace lost soldiers fast enough.
wiki_hell_strategy_para3: When you are able to handle it you should run as many patrols as you safely can, but do not over extend your forces.
wiki_hell_soul_gem_para1: %0 are a rare resource found in the %1 primarily by patrols.
wiki_hell_soul_gem_para2: Each patrol has a chance to find a Soul Gem when it has an enemy encounter, naturally this means the more patrols you run the more Soul Gems you will find.
wiki_hell_soul_gem_para3: You can construct the %0 to increase the odds of a patrol finding a Soul Gem, however this also raises the general threat level.
wiki_hell_soul_gem_para4: Build Attractors cautiously or you might summon more demons then you can handle.
wiki_hell_sim: This %0 written by %1 can be very a useful tool to calculate your Soul Gem drop rate as well as testing your defenses.
wiki_hell_infernite_para2: Surveyors need to be protected or they will be killed, high threat levels will cause massive casualties while low threat levels will let them do their jobs mostly unimpeded.
wiki_hell_infernite_para3: When a Surveyor dies it takes time to repair their vehicle, a small progress bar can be seen on the Carport showing the repair in progress.
wiki_hell_infernite_para4: The game will attempt to automatically reassign a Surveyor when a new carport becomes available.
wiki_hell_pit_para1: The Pit is discovered when you accumulate a total of %0 demon kills and have a %1.
wiki_hell_pit_para2: It grants access to the %0 which can be used as a kind of Soul Gem printer.
wiki_hell_pit_para3: Once the Soul Forge is repaired all demon kills slowly fill it with souls, when it reaches capacity you gain a Soul Gem.
wiki_hell_corrupted_para1: After you research %0 there is a chance for the %1 to produce a %2.
wiki_hell_corrupted_para2: This special one time resource can be researched to unlock the %0 area of hell.
wiki_hell_corrupted_para3: This is a deep expansion game area that is considered post %0 content.
wiki_hell_pillar_para1: The Ancient Pillars (AKA Circle of Pillars) found in the %0 can be activated once for every unique species.
wiki_hell_pillar_para2: This provides a stacking permanent bonus which gives you +%0 production bonus for each pillared species called %1.
wiki_hell_pillar_para3: An additional +%0 bonus is gained if you have ever pillared your current species.
wiki_hell_pillar_para4: %0 also provides a storage bonus of %1 for each pillared species and %2 if the current species is pillared.
wiki_hell_pillar_para5: Each activated pillar additionally discounts the number of %0 segments you need to build to open the ancient gate by %1.
wiki_hell_pillar_para6: Your current %0 bonus is: %1 Production, %2 Storage.
wiki_hell_spire_para1: The Spire is an infinite arena, you construct battle mechs to assault the spire and climb floors as you beat the floor boss on each level.
wiki_hell_spire_para2: There is no maximum floor, you can climb as high as you dare.
wiki_hell_spire_para3: Each floor gets progressively harder and you will randomly encounter one of forty boss types along with varying terrain and enviromental hazards.
wiki_hell_spire_para4: Beating a floor awards %0 which is a resource that can be used to buy permanent upgrades.
wiki_hell_spire_para5: Proceeding deep enough into the spire also allows you to access the %0 reset.
wiki_hell_mech_para1: Mechs are required to defeat the spire bosses.
wiki_hell_mech_para2: There are %0 types of mechs: %1, %2, %3, %4, and %5.
wiki_hell_scout_para1: The %0 mech has minimal firepower but provides a scouting bonus to all non-scout class mechs.
wiki_hell_scout_para2: It has %0 weapon mount and no equipment slots, or %1 equipment slot with the %2 upgrade.
wiki_hell_scout_para3: The Scout mech outputs a base %0 damage points per weapon.
wiki_hell_scout_para4: The Scout mech uses %0 mech bay space. It costs %1 supply and %2 soul gem to construct.
wiki_hell_scout_para5: Scout class mechs can use the special %0 equipment item.
wiki_hell_scout_para6: The scouting bonus provided by scout mechs helps reduce terrain penalties on all non-scout mechs.
wiki_hell_scout_para7: Each scout mech counters %0 of the terrain penalty.
wiki_hell_scout_para8: The scouting bonus is halved if the %0 or %1 hazards are in play.
wiki_hell_scout_para9: Scouting has no effect if the terrain multiplier is above %0 for a mech and can not be raised above %0 from scouting.
wiki_hell_scout_para10: Scout mechs are %0 less effective in the concrete terrain enviroment.
wiki_hell_standard_para2: It has %0 weapon mount and %1 equipment slot, or %2 equipment slots with the %3 upgrade.
wiki_hell_standard_para3: The Standard mech outputs a base %0 damage points per weapon.
wiki_hell_standard_para4: The Standard mech uses %0 mech bay space. It costs %1 supply and %2 soul gems to construct.
wiki_hell_standard_para5: Standard class mechs can use the special %0 equipment item.
wiki_hell_standard_para6: Standard mechs are %0 less effective in the concrete terrain enviroment.
wiki_hell_heavy_para1: The %0 mech is a large mech with superior firepower.
wiki_hell_heavy_para2: It has %0 weapon mounts and %1 equipment slots, or %2 equipment slots with the %3 upgrade.
wiki_hell_heavy_para3: The Heavy mech outputs a base %0 damage points per weapon.
wiki_hell_heavy_para4: The Heavy mech uses %0 mech bay space. It costs %1 supply and %2 soul gems to construct.
wiki_hell_heavy_para5: Heavy class mechs can use the special %0 equipment item.
wiki_hell_heavy_para6: Heavy mechs are more susceptible to terrain disadvantages.
wiki_hell_titan_para1: The %0 mech is a huge mech with massive firepower.
wiki_hell_titan_para2: It has %0 weapon mounts and %1 equipment slots, or %2 equipment slots with the %3 upgrade.
wiki_hell_titan_para3: The Titan mech outputs a base %0 damage points per weapon.
wiki_hell_titan_para4: The Titan mech uses %0 mech bay space. It costs %1 supply and %2 soul gems to construct.
wiki_hell_titan_para5: Titan class mechs can use the special %0 equipment item.
wiki_hell_titan_para6: Titan mechs are more susceptible to terrain disadvantages.
wiki_hell_titan_para7: Titan mechs are %0 more effective in the concrete terrain enviroment.
wiki_hell_collector_para1: %0 mechs do no damage but instead salvage supply resources from the spire.
wiki_hell_collector_para2: It has %0 equipment slots, or %1 equipment slots with the %2 upgrade.
wiki_hell_collector_para3: Collector mechs use %0 mech bay space. It costs %1 supply and %2 soul gem to construct.
wiki_hell_collector_para4: Collector class mechs can use the special %0 equipment item.
wiki_hell_collector_para5: Collector mechs are more susceptible to terrain disadvantages.
wiki_hell_chassis_para1: When constructing a mech they come in %0 different types: %1, %2, %3, %4, %5, & %6.
wiki_hell_chassis_para2: Each different type of mech has different stregths and weaknesses in the %0 different terrain enviroments.
wiki_hell_chassis_para3: The damage they do is directly scaled by this amount.
wiki_hell_chassis_para4: Scout and Standard mechs use the standard (S) value while all other mechs use the large (L) value.
wiki_hell_monsters_para1: Each monster has different weaknesses to different weapon types.
wiki_hell_monsters_para2: All %0 of the weapons types have the same base damage, however a weapon that works great on one monster may be ineffectual on another.
wiki_hell_monsters_para3: It is therefore a good idea to invest in a wide variety of weapons so you never have a situation where none of your mechs are doing any damage.
wiki_hell_monsters_para4: Alternatively you could scrap your mechs and rebuild them on each level for maximum effeciency but it's recommended to instead just invest in a wide variety of mech configurations.
wiki_hell_hazard_para1: Spire floors can come with hazards.
wiki_hell_hazard_para2: Hazards impede mech effectiveness unless countered by equipment or other special means.

wiki_events_xmas_para6: The 2021 gift contained: 100 + Resets + Mad Resets Plasmids, Bioseeds + Cataclysms Phage, Lifetime soldier deaths Coal, 0-4 Dark Energy, 0-5 Harmony Crystals, 0-25 Blood Stones, 0-5 Artifacts, and 0-5 AI Cores.
